intro: Hieracium purpureovittatum, commonly known as the purple-veined hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow with purple veins, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
